messages: b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (09:55): Did Opera ship a browser for Windows Phone 7 today? Mini? Java translated to CLR?
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (10:13): OMG! double (positive) digit temperatures!
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (10:16): b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9: More to the point, did we put a picture on opera.com depicting Windows as an aging rock drummer?
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (10:17): b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9: FWIW, you're not going to get an answer to that from anywhere. Apart from the fact that we did indeed ship.
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (10:19): a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554: I think the answer is no, isn't it? Unless I don't understand our press release
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (10:19): a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554: I see that Opera shipped on Symbian and Android. Was anything shipped on an kind of handheld Windows today?
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (10:19): "The Opera Mobile 11 browser [...] Windows 7 desktop (labs release)"
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (10:19): AFAICT, nothing was shipped for Windows or iOS
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (10:20): interesting
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (10:20): Oooh.
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (10:20): Stop assuming I've read stuff.
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (10:20): :)
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (10:20): b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea: so it's for Windows 7 tablets?
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (10:20): anyway, congratulations for shipping
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (10:21): b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9: I think that is the idea
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (10:21): does Mobile on Android support WebM?
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (10:21): also, kudos for not losing my Opera Mini settings this time
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (10:21): Oh, yay, first stable release with JIT for ARM. I can claim to have done something that's part of it.
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (10:21): Not sure, I would have to find the documentation
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (10:22): my Opera Mobile settings were lost, though
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (10:24): on the bringht side, this time the UX for logging into an existing Opera Link account for the first time in a given Opera Mobile installations sucks less
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (10:25): that is, this time the setup process gives feedback that the first sync is happening and lets the user know when the first sync is done
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (10:26): now Speed Dial rerendered the thumbnails, so I lost the face of Jimmy Wales :-(
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (10:27): (on the Speed Dial entry for Wikipedia that is)
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (10:28): Gosh, that sounds like a terrible loss. Were you just enjoying prodding him in the eyes to access stuff?
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (10:29): Opera Mobile on S60 seems to have regressed @font-face support
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (10:29): but has gained <video> support
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (10:29): in such a way that trying to play a video brings up a download prompt
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (10:30): I will probably have to edit webm.html5.org to special case Opera Mobile 11
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (10:31): That doesn't sound ideal :(
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (10:31): b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea: especially when .play() from JS brings up the download prompt
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (10:31): But it might be platform-specific; it seems to work fine on the windows 7 version
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (10:45): does anyone here happen to have Opera Mobile 11 on Symbian^3?
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (10:45): what happens on http://webm.html5.org/ in Opera Mobile 11 on Symbian^3?
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (11:01): b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9: Filed your issues
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (11:04): using IE9 to navigate to m.opera.com for the Windows 7 version fails
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (11:08): also, the Windows 7 installer isn't signed
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (11:11): b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9: What S60 device are you using?
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (11:17): hmm. the press release says Opera Mobile 11 is available for Maemo. Does that mean Maemo 5 only or also Maemo 4? my Maemo 4 device didn't autoupdate
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (11:22): hmm. I don't see any Maemo download for Opera Mobile 11
